Package de.ovgu.softwareprojekt.pipeline.filters

This package contains all filters written for the framework.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbsoluteFilter
    This filter replaces any negative sensor data values with their absolute.
    AbstractFilter
    This abstract filter implements a lot of the interface methods used by the inherited classes and provides the DataSink.
    AveragingFilter
    This filter replaces incoming sensor data with the average over the last n values.
    DifferenceThresholdFilter
    This filter zeroes sensor data when the difference between two successive data points is not large enough
    IntegratingFilter
    This filter integrates over all previous values by adding them.
    MinimumAmplitudeChangeFilter
    This filter ignores changes in sensor data up to a certain margin, for example to avoid shaking when trying not to move a mouse.
    ScalingFilter
    This class scales sensor values.
    TemporaryIntegratingFilter
    This filter sums up the previous n values
    ThresholdingFilter
    This filter zeroes sensor data when the amplitude of a specified axis does not exceed a set minimum.
    UserSensitivityMultiplicator
    This class multiplies the data by the incoming user sensitivity, and forwards the data with a user sensitivity of 1f.

Package de.ovgu.softwareprojekt.pipeline.filters Description

This package contains all filters written for the framework. You may use them yourself. The easiest way to create your own filter is to subclass AbstractFilter, as it implements some interface functions you probably don't need, and forces you to implement those that are needed.
